issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
In the Atlanta solution center cloud we need to use cfn-init to bootstrap the instances. The cfn-init fails to execute saying validation error, that stack does not exists.

We created the stack with the management console. The template is attached to this ticket. Not sure why cfn-init says no stack with that ARN exists because a simple listing of stacks on the cloud shows matching ARN existing. 

The network trace on the UFS host shows the following:

{code}
T 10.10.219.70:42284 -> 10.10.206.16:8773 [AP]
GET /services/CloudFormation/?Action=DescribeStackResource&StackName=arn%3Aaws%3Acloudformation%3Aeucalyptus%3A000996324612%3Astack%2FVPCAutoscaling%2F9b7b96f4-18ed-49d2-8c11-c207e343afbe&Version=2010-05-15&ContentType=JSON&LogicalResourceId=WebServerLaunchConfig HTTP/1.1 
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate 
Connection: keep-alive 
Accept: application/json 
User-Agent: CloudFormation Tools 
Host: 10.10.206.16:8773 
X-Amz-Date: 20151121T144354Z 
X-Amz-Security-Token: ZXVjYQABEJYYaGj1gDOKu+MZ2XJqglzwCJi4a/xezICPGmGgyzEMfln3cmpORWCQbkTuA1xCJ8Ylpj81mfoXwZmkESGbijrEEXlGaBG57juHLfZ7GgByWh0RVHFAE1IgGj3WJBrTtJ6wGOewt3FhkLf5GKnSCJJXOGPa32x7TKoPxVOwDByPazVjjZaEzIXNUgGd6u7vK1FM4N0V8R8SR6By36jKE5ZjaKz7xgmAxm2h1dOZ4D2JpYHVKsBV 
Authorization: AWS4-HMAC-SHA256 Credential=AKIAA7ZMZYIAGPAYWA5W/20151121/eucalyptus/cloudformation/aws4_request,SignedHeaders=accept;host;x-amz-date;x-amz-security-token, Signature=a32bfe15d355d2a1e93f761d5b5ed1b081d52d5d6773bca0b91b9ee7f8c77af7 
 

##
T 10.10.206.16:8773 -> 10.10.219.70:42284 [AP]
HTTP/1.1 400 ValidationError 
Content-Length: 251 
Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8 
Date: Sat, 21 Nov 2015 14:43:54 UTC 
 
{"RequestId":"3dcb26b4-c82a-4c7f-ae47-5286b1c10a5a","Error":{"Type":"Sender","Code":"ValidationError","Message":"Stack with name arn:aws:cloudformation:eucalyptus:000996324612:stack/VPCAutoscaling/9b7b96f4-18ed-49d2-8c11-c207e343afbe does not exist"}}
{code}
fields.summary: cfn-init fails with validation error saying stack does not exist

comments.body: [~dshekhawat], please also attach the policies and assume role policy for the "roleVPC" role.

From inside the instance I can use AWS CLI and the role to describe the stack but cfn-init does not work

{code}
# aws --endpoint-url http://10.10.206.16:8773/services/CloudFormation cloudformation describe-stacks
{
    "Stacks": [
        {
            "StackId": "arn:aws:cloudformation:eucalyptus:000996324612:stack/VPCAutoscaling/56858459-b81a-48ce-aa02-a1162cedc32b",
            "Description": "Eucalyptus CloudFormation Sample Template VPC_AutoScaling_With_Public_IPs.template: Sample template showing how to create a load balanced, auto scaled group in a Eucalyptus VPC where the  instances can directly access the internet.",

                {
                    "ParameterValue": "testkey",
                    "ParameterKey": "KeyName"
                },
                {
                    "ParameterValue": "http://10.10.206.16:8773/services/CloudFormation",
                    "ParameterKey": "EndPoint"
                },
                {
                    "ParameterValue": "0.0.0.0/0",
                    "ParameterKey": "SSHLocation"
                },
                {
                    "ParameterValue": "m1.medium",
                    "ParameterKey": "WebServerInstanceType"
                },
                {
                    "ParameterValue": "1",
                    "ParameterKey": "WebServerCount"
                }
            ],
            "Outputs": [
                {
                    "Description": "URL of the website",
                    "OutputKey": "WebSite",
                    "OutputValue": "http://VPCAutos-PublicEla-H6MNJE1NLSOFW-000996324612.lb.atlpocloud.local"
                }
            ],
            "StackStatusReason": "Complete!",
            "CreationTime": "2015-11-21T17:39:25.303Z",
            "Capabilities": [
                "CAPABILITY_IAM"
            ],
            "StackName": "VPCAutoscaling",
            "StackStatus": "CREATE_COMPLETE",
            "DisableRollback": false,
            "LastUpdatedTime": "2015-11-21T17:39:43.814Z"
        }
    ]
}

# /opt/aws/bin/cfn-init -v --stack arn:aws:cloudformation:eucalyptus:000996324612:stack/VPCAutoscaling/56858459-b81a-48ce-aa02-a1162cedc32b --resource WebServerLaunchConfig --url http://10.10.206.16:8773/services/CloudFormation --role roleVPC --region eucalyptus

ValidationError: Stack with name arn:aws:cloudformation:eucalyptus:000996324612:stack/VPCAutoscaling/56858459-b81a-48ce-aa02-a1162cedc32b does not exist
{code}

[~dshekhawat], please try making the describe stack resource call manually from the instance. If you see the same "Stack ... does not exist" failure then try removing the "eucalyptus" region name from the ARN when describing to see if that makes a difference (or describe using only the name, rather than the full ARN). If that does make a difference then set the cloudformation region property to "eucalyptus" and retry the stack creation.

I will try it as per your suggestion but one thing to note is that in this install the cloudformation region property came set with eucalyptus. Not sure if the calyptos install did it already for us or this is the system default.

For reference I am sharing the cloudformation properties on this system and their respective values.

{code}
cloudformation.autoscaling_group_deleted_max_delete_retry_secs = 300
cloudformation.autoscaling_group_zero_instances_max_delete_retry_secs = 300
cloudformation.instance_attach_volume_max_create_retry_secs = 300
cloudformation.instance_running_max_create_retry_secs = 300
cloudformation.instance_terminated_max_delete_retry_secs = 300
cloudformation.max_attributes_per_mapping = 30
cloudformation.max_mappings_per_template = 100
cloudformation.max_outputs_per_template = 60
cloudformation.max_parameters_per_template = 60
cloudformation.max_resources_per_template = 200
cloudformation.region = eucalyptus
cloudformation.request_template_body_max_length_bytes = 51200
cloudformation.request_template_url_max_content_length_bytes = 460800
cloudformation.security_group_max_delete_retry_secs = 300
cloudformation.subnet_max_delete_retry_secs = 300
cloudformation.swf_activity_worker_config = 
cloudformation.swf_domain = CloudFormationDomain
cloudformation.swf_tasklist = CloudFormationTaskList
cloudformation.url_domain_whitelist = *s3.amazonaws.com
cloudformation.volume_attachment_max_create_retry_secs = 300
cloudformation.volume_available_max_create_retry_secs = 300
cloudformation.volume_deleted_max_delete_retry_secs = 300
cloudformation.volume_detachment_max_delete_retry_secs = 300
cloudformation.volume_snapshot_complete_max_delete_retry_secs = 300
cloudformation.wait_condition_bucket_prefix = cf-waitcondition
{code}

[~dshekhawat], this is a bug, using the stack id should work. It looks like this issue may only occur when using an administrative account such as "eucalyptus". If this is the case then another work-around would be to use a regular account.
Thanks [~sjones] I will be using non-euca account for the use case fulfilment purposes going forward.

To verify this issue create a stack using the eucalyptus account and the template:

{code}
{
  "AWSTemplateFormatVersion" : "2010-09-09",
  "Description" : "Simple security group template",
  "Resources" : {
    "SecurityGroup" : {
     "Type" : "AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup",
     "Properties" : {
         "GroupDescription" : "Test group"
     }
    }
  }
}
{code}

as the eucalyptus account run:

{code}
# 
# vi group-template.json # paste in content of security group template
# 
# 
# euform-create-stack --template-file group-template.json group-stack-1
arn:aws:cloudformation::000945104907:stack/group-stack-1/607cceda-004d-4af1-a3e8-8587a5251334
# 
# 
# 
# euform-describe-stack-resource -l SecurityGroup group-stack-1
RESOURCE	SecurityGroup	group-stack-1-SecurityGroup-V1CVHTNIV4PXZ	AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup	2015-12-24T00:56:41.431Z	CREATE_COMPLETE	
# 
# 
# 
# euform-describe-stacks --show-long group-stack-1
STACK	group-stack-1	CREATE_COMPLETE	Complete!	Simple security group template	2015-12-24T00:56:37.503Z
arn:aws:cloudformation::000945104907:stack/group-stack-1/607cceda-004d-4af1-a3e8-8587a5251334
None
# 
# 
# 
# euform-describe-stack-resource -l SecurityGroup arn:aws:cloudformation::000945104907:stack/group-stack-1/607cceda-004d-4af1-a3e8-8587a5251334
RESOURCE	SecurityGroup	group-stack-1-SecurityGroup-V1CVHTNIV4PXZ	AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup	2015-12-24T00:56:41.431Z	CREATE_COMPLETE	
# 
# 
{code}

which verifies that the resource can be described using the stack name and the stack id. When describing using the stack id ensure the value output by the previous command is used.

Issue fixed.  Refer to QA-499 for steps.  In the cfn-init.log, the following contents are present which confirm this issue is resolved:
{code}
